channel.title: Posts on Mathieu @ ULaval
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Mathieu @ ULaval

item.title: GRAAL
item.description: I’m glad to be part of the GRAAL research group for this summer. The group is led by François Laviolette and Mario Marchand and their interests are mainly machine learning and its applications. This is my first experience with machine learning and it should be fun!

item.title: GIREF
item.description: This summer I will join the GIREF research group under the supervision of José Urquiza. Their main focus are numerical methods commonly used in engineering such as the finite element method.

item.title: RAMiCS 2017
item.description: I’m happy to announce that the submitted paper with Jules Desharnais titled “Relation as Images” has been accepted at RAMiCS 2017. Therefore, I’ll be in Lyon (France) in early May to present our recent work. This paper primarily defines two basic morphological operations (dilation and erosion) on binary images using a formalism from relation algebra.

item.title: LSFM
item.description: I’m thrilled to join the LSFM research group for this summer under the supervision of Jules Desharnais. Their interests lies in languages, semantics, formal and algebraic methods. I couldn’t ask for a better first research experience!
